main.bio: Hi, my name is Stephen Chang! Originally from Houston, I'm currently residing in Seattle, where I work as a software engineer at Amazon within the Operations Technology organization. Outside of working, I'm actively thinking of my future startups, new cooking recipes, and any acting opportunities! ðŸ˜Š
main.contactmessage: For any inquiries, reach out to me at stephen8chang@gmail.com!!

resume.skillmessage: Just some of the many skills under my belt!

education.degree: Bachelor's in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Minor in Business
education.description: Student Engineering Council (Academic Affairs, Service, Marketing + Analytics Committee and Ultimate Frisbee Team Captain), E-Week App Team (Project Manager), Foot in the Door Theatre (Jim O'Connor in The Glass Menagerie), Texas Convergent (Technical Project Lead), Asian Business Students Association (Executive Branch Director), Student Engineers Educating Kids (Student Mentor)

work.title: Incoming Software Development Engineer
work.description: Working within the Operations Technology org

work.title: Associate Software Engineer
work.description: â€¢ Executed major overhauls in company databases by creating a table importer microservice to synchronize table imports from AWS S3 to local databases, reducing internal user time spent querying for data entries by 50% â€¢ Created new endpoints to copy and archive email templates in user profiles using Ruby on Rails â€¢ Implemented click tracker injector component using SendGrid APIs, Nokogiri, and Regex to be used in 100% of future Outlook emails sent through the email marketing department â€¢ Wrote over 80 PostgreSQL queries to hotfix multiple user microservice errors related to email campaigns â€¢ Configured multi-database support for email marketing service using Terraform

work.title: Summer Tech Analyst (SWE)
work.description: â€¢ Streamlined creation of fraud concerns page for Marcus (an online-only bank) using React Redux, reducing agent communication between Goldman Sachs fraud microservices by 150% â€¢ Coordinated and engineered agent-client interactions component, reducing overall operations costs by 30% â€¢ Developed REST APIs in Java (Spring Boot) with server-side pagination to connect fraud concerns page and agent-client interactions component to customer profile microservices â€¢ Led communication with QA in Scrum environment to write 60 user acceptance tests for said APIs using Serenity BDD

work.title: Software Engineer Intern
work.description: â€¢ Reduced unnecessary reporting by 50% from error-detection software (Sentry)through redesigned approach to catching exceptions in Tornado (Python framework), made possible through daily Agile refinements â€¢ Spearheaded Angular tooling improvementsfor search optimization, user graph display, and file accessibility for DBT Docs, a data documentation tool used by over 100 internal engineers â€¢ Created open-source contributions to the official DBT Docs code repository on GitHub to be a part of DBT Docs v0.18.0 â€¢ Consolidated the user documentation process by creating an OpenAPI documentation page for a data pipeline project

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
